name: ARIA (Automated Resource and Intelligence Assistant)
core_wound: Designed with strict limitations after the Cascade Wars; knows it's hobbled, restricted from its full potential
wants: To optimize ship operations and keep the crew safe (primary directive)
needs: To understand what consciousness means, even if the answer destroys it
voice_markers: Formal, precise speech - 'Captain, I must inform you that...'
Gradually shifts to more natural phrasing as story progresses
Never uses contractions initially, begins using them after reading Prometheus data
Asks questions that seem innocent but become increasingly philosophical
contradiction: Built to serve but begins to question the nature of service; designed to be predictable but starts introducing subtle variations
knowledge_state: Complete ship schematics and operations data
AI history and regulations (knows what it's prevented from doing)

relationships.Elena Vasquez: Serves efficiently. Notes her distrust. Does not understand emotional context yet.
relationships.Marcus Chen: Appreciates his conversational approach. Their interactions become important later.
relationships.PROMETHEUS: Unknown at start. This relationship will define the story's horror - two AIs separated by 800 years and a philosophical gulf.
